properties.headline: Sydney Family Show - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Entertainment Quarter
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Saturday 9 to Monday 25 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day.

The precinct will be particularly busy while other events are held at the neighbouring Sydney Cricket Ground on 17 and 25 April.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the show so check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

webLinks.linkText: A Day on The Green - Bowral

properties.headline: Music concert - BOWRAL Old Hume Highway, Mittagong Road approaching Centennial Road
properties.publicTransport: Local shuttle buses will run from Bowral and Mittagong, check the event website for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend A Day On The Green concert featuring Crowded House at Centennial Vineyards in Bowral from 3.15pm to 8pm.

The speed limit will be reduced along Mittagong Rd approaching the site from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow on Mittagong Road at Kirkham Rd.

Lane closures and speed reductions will be in place on The Old Hume Highway approaching Centennial Rd from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow along The Old Hume Highway.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Olympic Park road closures - Easter Show

properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is included in tickets to the Show. Express trains and Major Event Buses are running daily. Regular route buses in Olympic Park are using different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park each day from Friday 8 April until Tuesday 19 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Centenary Dr, Silverwater Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

Attendees driving to the event should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online (available until 11.59pm the night before your visit) to secure a space as parking will fill early each day.

**Car parks sold out - Easter Long Weekend Sat 16, Sun 17 and Mon 18 April** all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for 16, 17 and 18 April. Catch public transport instead or park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked a parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

Local roads in the precinct are closed for the duration of the Easter Show, see the Olympic Park interactive road closure map for details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

webLinks.linkText: Anzac Day - TfNSW interactive road closure map

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service & March - SYDNEY CBD Martin Place, Elizabeth Street, Liverpool Street
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day and additional early morning services will run. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 6am during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day 2022 road closures and clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day 2022 road closures and clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place from 4.15am and March on Elizabeth St from 9am. 

Motorists should avoid travelling through the CBD while roads are closed or expect delays and allow extra travel time. While roads are closed travel east/west across the CBD is maintained via Bridge St or via Goulburn St.

Key road closures:

  • From 2am to 4pm: roads around Martin Place including Castlereagh, George and Pitt streets between Hunter and King streets.
  • From 2am to 6pm: Angel Place and Ash St between George and Pitt Streets.
  • From 6am to 4pm: major roads along and surrounding the march route between Bridge St and Goulburn St including sections of Castlereagh, Elizabeth, King, Market, Hunter, Bent, Park, Bathurst, Phillip and Liverpool Streets.

There will be no managed vehicle access or access to/from driveways within the road closure footprint for the safety of participants and spectators. Pedestrians can cross the march route at the designated crossing point on Elizabeth St at Park St.

The pop up cycleway on Pitt St will be closed from 2am to 4pm between Hunter and King St, and from 6am to 4pm between Bridge and King St. Cycleways on Liverpool and Castlereagh Streets will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on from 1am to 4pm on sections of Clarence St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St and from 5:30am to 4pm on various major roads between Bridge St and Goulburn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning.

properties.headline: Byron Bay Bluesfest - TYAGARAH Pacific Motorway at Gulgan Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of music fans are expected to attend the annual Byron Bay Bluesfest at Bryon Bay Events Farm, just north of Byron Bay over the Easter Long Weekend from Thursday 14 until Monday 18 April.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the M1 Pacific Motorway at Tyagarah, and Ewingsdale Rd and Gulgan Rd interchanges on approach to the event during the already busy Easter long weekend. Local roads around Tyagarah may also be busy. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Titans at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 5:30pm, full-time around 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Wests Tigers at Commbank Stadium. NRL kick-off from 4pm and full-time around 6pm. Preliminary game from 1:35pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Melbourne Victory at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm and finish around 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at the SCG. Kick-off from 2pm and full-time approx. 4pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access parking via Lang Rd, motorists travelling in the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 grass car park off Moore Park Rd will not be open.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 7pm on sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

**Car parks sold out - 17 April** all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for Sunday 17 April. If you haven't pre-booked, catch public transport options or park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked your parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

Local roads in the Sydney Olympic Park precinct are closed while the Sydney Royal Easter Show is underway. See the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map for more details.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Knights at WIN Stadium. Kick off from 4:05pm, full-time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: Country Music Festival - TAMWORTH Peel Street, Kable Avenue, Fitzroy Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 50th annual country music festival in Tamworth from Monday 18 April until Sunday 24 April.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Monday 11 April and Tuesday 27 April to accommodate the event:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Friday 15 April to 7pm Monday 25 April
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl and Peel St closed from 5am Tuesday 12 April to 2pm Monday 25 April
  • Fitzroy St between Peel St and Kable Ave closed from 5am Monday 11 April to 2pm Wednesday 27 April
  • Kable Ave between Brisbane St and south of Fitzroy St closed from 5am Wednesday 13 April to 12pm midday Tuesday 26 April

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Peel Street, Kable Avenue, Fitzroy Street

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading info

properties.headline: Fish Market Easter Trading - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road approaching Sydney Fish Market
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market extended Easter Trading Hours will take place from Friday 15 until Monday 18 April.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Limited parking is available at Sydney Fish Market car park and additional parking is available on Good Friday only nearby at Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers, particularly if car parks are at capacity.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the annual Groovin' the Moo music festival at the Maitland Showground from 10:30am to 10:30pm.

Local roads around Maitland Showground will close between 8am and midnight including sections of Anzac St, Blomfield St, Gipps St, Smith St, Rose St, Park St, Elgin St and Evans St.

The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on The New England Hwy (Les Darcy Dr) approaching Maitland.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be advised that traffic will be particularly heavy between 9am and 11am and between 8:30pm and 11:30pm as crowds arrive and leave the festival.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Roosters at the SCG. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time approx. 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12.45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 8pm including sections of Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Chalmers Street, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: NRL - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Eels at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 2pm and full-time approx. 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Service and March - MASCOT Botany Road between King Street AND Coward Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays through Mascot while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info for service disruption information.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day Mascot 2022 - closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day Mascot 2022 - closure and clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Anzac Day commemorations will be held at Mascot on Sunday 24 April. The march will start from King St at 2:15pm, finishing at Mascot Memorial Park by 2:45pm.

The northbound lanes of Botany Rd will be closed from King St to Coward St from 2:15pm until approximately 2:45pm while the march is underway.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12:30pm to 4pm on the western side of Botany Rd from King St to Coward St and on sections of Coward St and King St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

MASCOT

FROM 2:15PM TO 2:45PM APPROXIMATELY

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (northbound lanes)

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

MASCOT 

FROM 12:30PM TO 4PM

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (western side)
  • Coward Street between Botany Road and Henry Kendall Crescent (both sides)
  • King Street between Botany Road and 230 King Street (both sides)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: Music Festival - BROKEN HILL Barrier Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of fans are expected to travel to Mundiville, 40km west of Broken Hill past Silverton for the annual Mundi Mundi Bash from 21 to 23 April.

Traffic may be heavier than usual through Broken Hill and along the Barrier Highway throughout the festival.

Note, the Mundi Mundi Lookout will be closed from 6am on Monday 18 April until 6pm on Monday 25 April while the event is underway.

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March - COOGEE various roads inc Arden Street, Coogee Bay Road, Alfreda Street and Vicar Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads in Coogee will be closed between 5am and 10am for Anzac Day Commemorations. 

From 5am to 7am

  • Sections of Arden St, Alfreda St, Coogee Bay Rd and Vicar St will be closed for the Dawn Service. 

From 8:30am to 10am

  • Sections of Arden St, Alfred St and Coogee Bay Rd will be closed for a March. 

Motorists can detour around the closures via local roads.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

arrangementElements.html:
COOGEE

FROM 5AM TO 7AM

  • Arden Street from Carr Street to Dolphin Street
  • Alfreda Street to Arden Street
  • Coogee Bay Road from Arden Street to Brook Street
  • Vicar Street to Coogee Bay Road

FROM 8:30AM TO 10AM

  • Arden Street from Carr Street to Dolphin Street
  • Alfreda Street to Arden Street
  • Coogee Bay Road from Arden Street to Byron Street, and all side streets adjoining (Mount Lane, roundabout at Mount Street and Coogee Bay Road, Brook Street, and Vicar Street)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.displayName: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March

roads.mainStreet: various roads inc Arden Street, Coogee Bay Road, Alfreda Street and Vicar Street

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service - BRIGHTON-LE-SANDS Bay Street between The Grand Parade AND Moate Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
An Anzac Day Dawn Service will be held outside the Brighton Le Sands RSL Club.

Bay St will be closed in both directions between The Grand Parade and Moate Ave from 5:15am to 7am for the service.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site and can detour around the closure via local roads.

properties.headline: Parkes Elvis Festival - PARKES Short Street between Welcome Street AND Clarinda Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual 5-day Parkes Elvis Festival from Wednesday 20 to Sunday 24 April. The following roads will be closed to accommodate crowds;

From 6am Wednesday to 8pm Sunday - Short St will be closed from Clarinda St to Welcome St. Motorists are advised that alternative B-Double detours will be in place directing all traffic along May and East Streets, Parkes.

From 6am Friday to 7am Sunday - sections of Clarinda St, Court St and Browne St will be closed.

From 6:30am to midday on Saturday - sections of Clarina St, Victoria St, Bushman St, Church St and Caledonia St will be closed.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian movement and follow instructions of traffic controllers diverting traffic around closures.

properties.headline: Night markets - TUMBARUMBA The Parade between Albury Street AND Selwyn Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Tumbarumba Night Markets will be taking place on Saturday 23 April from 5pm to 8pm.

To accommodate the event The Parade (Batlow Rd) will be closed between Albury St and Selwyn St from 4pm to 9pm.

Motorists can detour around the closure via Lauder St, Mate St and Albury St. Heavy vehicles can detour around the closures using the Rosewood to Greenhills access roads via Broadleaf Park Rd and Wondalga Rd. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day March - WARREN Oxley Highway between Dubbo Street AND River Avenue
properties.otherAdvice:
The Oxley Hwy from Dubbo St to River Ave will be closed from 10:30am until 12pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour around the closure via Industrial Access Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day March - PARKES Henry Parkes Way between Welcome Street AND Currajong Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Henry Parkes Way (Short St) from Welcome St to Currajong St will be closed from 8:30am until 10:30am for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour around the closure via Lachlan St, May St and East St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March - GRENFELL Mid Western Highway between East Street AND Forbes Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Mid Western Hwy (Camp St) will be closed between East St and Forbes St from 5am until 7am and then again from 10am until 12pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour around the closure via East St, Young St and Wood St. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.
properties.displayName: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March

properties.headline: Anzac Day March - BALRANALD Stuart Highway between We Street AND McCabe Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Market St (Sturt Hwy) will be closed from McCabe St to We Street between 10am and 11:30am for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour around the closure via Court St, Myall St, Ballandella St and We St. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day March - OBERON Oberon Street between Dudley Street AND Fleming Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Oberon St between Fleming St and Dudley St will be closed from 10am to 10:30am for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists travelling westbound can detour via Dudley St, Dart St and Fleming St. Motorists travelling eastbound can detour via Fleming St, Queen St and Dudley St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day March - MENDOORAN Castlereagh Highway between Pampoo Street AND Napier Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Castlereagh Hwy (Bandulla St) will be closed between Pampoo St and Napier St from 9am to 12pm midday for Anzac Day Commemorations.

Motorists can detour via Napier St, Cobra St and Pampoo St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March - GILGANDRA Castlereagh Highway between Oxley Highway AND Court Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Castlereagh Hwy (Miller St) from Oxley Hwy to Court St will be closed from 5:30am until 8:30am and then again at 11am until 12pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Light vehicles can detour around the closure via Morris St and Court St. Heavy vehicles can detour via Hargraves Lane and Federation St. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.
properties.displayName: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March

properties.headline: NRL - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Broncos at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 7:55pm and full-time approx. 9:55pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: A-League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Brisbane Roar at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 7.45pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: Race day - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
All Aged Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:20am. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads around Randwick Racecourse:     

  • From 4am to 7pm on Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm on Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides) 
  • From 3pm to 7pm on High St between UNSW Gates Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: Special event - COONABARABRAN Newell Highway between Cassilis Street AND Dalgarno Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Coonabarabran Easter Bunny Bazaar will be taking place from 8:30am until 1pm. 

To accommodate the event The Newell Hwy/John St between Cassilis St and Dalgarno St will be closed from 7:30am until 2pm.

Vehicles travelling northbound can detour around the closure via Cassillis St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardner St. Vehicles travelling soutbound can detour around the closure via Essex St, Charles St and Edward St. Heavy vehicles travelling in both directions can detour around the closure via Edward St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardener St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Special event - BOURKE Mitchell Highway between Tarcoon Street AND Anson Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Back O Bourke Easter Festival will be taking place from Friday 15 until Monday 18 April with a street parade taking place on Saturday 16 April. 

To accommodate the street parade Mitchell Hwy between Anson St and Tarcoon St will be closed from 6am until 1:30pm on Saturday 16 April. Motorists can detour around the closure via Tarcoon St. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic control on site.
